it looks like master/worker can't connect to zk.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18378986/81293969-c3101680-90a0-11ea-87e5-ac9f0dd53f5e.png)
Is this the same as ‘stop’ ?

and shell task return code is 0, not -1 in log
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16174111/81313390-64579680-90ba-11ea-9339-577609282a2d.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16174111/81313322-530e8a00-90ba-11ea-96ef-e144ed952d6f.png)
You should alter app_link's type to longtext，then work well

please check the config of your cloudera-manager
'yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications'
if too small, the appIds's state will not return 'SUCCESS'
then shell task's state is FAILURE.

you can add a checking use historyserver,but you have to check the config:mapreduce.jobhistory.max-age-ms first

It means execute command using user 'hdfs' when you use 'sudo -u hdfs', but this file owner is 'apple ', example, I use 'dolphinscheduler' as startup user, like this 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26102201/81360014-449d8e00-910d-11ea-81cc-2ce19afb8cc5.png)
the tenant you set is actual command execution user, but 'hdfs' is usually a special user about authority, try another user and it work fine？

Hi, we find that #2614 has fixed this issue.

i find the problem:
the logic of this code is when the default 'env/dolphinscheduler.env' not exists, system would use the startup user home profile, because of the startup user is not same as the tenant, that can cause permissions problems.
if we start worker server from command line normally, there is no problem, because 'env/dolphinsheduler.env' exists in the 'conf' folder.
but i start worker server from idea, the 'env/dolphinscheduler.env' is not exists in 'common' moudle, so the permission problem arise.
